title: Migrated the Job's Copy Teams backend toolkit from Angular to React.    This is part of a larger initiative to eliminate our dependency on an aging version of Angular.
Increased the default size for formula editing windows to make editing those monster formulas more pleasant than trying to peer at it four lines at a time.
Resolved an issue where  "re-evaluate workflow " would incorrectly delete sub-workflows.

A while ago, we added a great feature to Execute's Document Synchronization to automatically inactivate records when they no longer appeared in the source data.  Now, we'll automatically reactivate those records if they come back!
We've added a new  "Copy from Sample " button when creating a new in-app plugin to make it much easier to preload your plugin with a sample from the plugins_available folder.
Administrators with the  "Manage Excel Templates " privilege can now upload and manage Excel Template Reports from Tools > Configuration > Manage Excel Template Reports.
Added support for publishing Execute events to a file on a remote server using SFTP.
Document Link Summary tabs are now hidden on un-saved documents to avoid an annoying pop-up error.
Support packages no longer inadvertently include some security sensitive configuration files.
Added new AFE-level calculated fields to allow reporting on reviewer and approver counts (both totals, and those who have completed their work).
Resolved issue where API keys were still inadvertently taking a license in some situations.
Changed the default minimum password length to 12 (doesn't affect environments using SSO).
Added handy Select All / Select None buttons to the support package generation screen.
Resolved issue where slow connectivity to Azure SQL or Snowflake could block saving documents elsewhere in Execute.
